weather_report:
Evening has settled over Subiaco with a quilt of broken cloud softening the streetlights and dimming the last of the day’s edges. The glare is gone and the UV has gone with it, effectively asleep until morning; the sky feels muted, the air a touch heavy, as if considering its next move. Clarity is fair but gentle, a night of scattered texture rather than crisp stars.

Those clouds are set to linger through late evening, with light rain likely drifting in after midnight and giving the footpaths a quiet shine. It’s a mild-to-cool sort of night: a light layer will do if you’re stepping out, plus a compact umbrella or a simple rain shell for the wee hours, and shoes you won’t mind meeting damp pavements. It’s a good window for an unhurried stroll before the sprinkles arrive, a slow grocery top-up, or clearing the kitchen while the radio murmurs; if you do cycle, lights and an easy pace will serve you well on slick corners. Gardeners can let the sky take care of the watering, and those at home might crack a window for the first whiff of petrichor, then close it when the drops begin.
